Because they either ACTUALLY used mocap to get the animations, or they did some 3d roto-scoping to get it right, because they got it right there.
But the rest werent up to par huh...
But Sora and the gang have all of half a different animation cycles they used to fill out every single cut scene.
*Relaxed Stance" *Gestures vaguely with hands stance* *Hands one head stance* *Return to relaxed stance*
The exact same animations. Every. Single. Time.
Sometimes they throw in a *Confused head shake* and a *Takes step back in surprise* in there to shake it up.
Lot of japan games do that type of thnig
And because they need to have a cut scene every two minutes, it gets super old, suuuuuuper quick.
Sure, but this isn't just some Japanese visual novel (as much as it tries to be). It's friggin Square Enix. You'd think that after FFXV they'd be all for good animation cyles?
Even that had repetition, but at least they had the common courtesy to make them fluid.
KH3 animation transitions are some janky shit man.
Then there's the combat that is some of the most brain dead combat Ive ever seen.
Has it been 5 seconds? Here have an action button cut scene attack.

Donald and Goofy and whatever guest also function kinda like summons.

Press triangle to kill everything but monsters with more than four bars.
And don't even think about trying to make the game harder by forcing skill checks on yourself by using parries. Because that is broken as fuck.
I need indoor mittens :ctwokinds-sadtrace2: unfortunately I am not a Snep
Monsters and especially bosses see parrying as more of a suggestion to be stunlocked for a counter, more than an actual rule.
I've completely given up on parrying.
"Pleased be stunned" "I'll think about it, no
Get a parry. Engage the counter attack. Still get hit because the mosnter gets to keep attacking.
Screw it. Just dodge and press the action button for an auto-win.

But don't worry about getting hit really. If your HP falls too low, just hit the action button to turn into Demon Sora, restore all of your hp, and one hit blink attack everything for 20 seconds.
Sounds like a big let down
No matter how cool other aspects of a game is if the gameplay is bad its over
The story is pretty balls too.
I'm used to the Disney Worlds not mattering to the overall game, but KH3 has taken it to the next level of Sora not even mattering in most of them either.
An overwhelming majority of the worlds are just straight one to one repeats of the movie they're based off of.
And Sora is just kind of along for the ride.
I haven't yet finished the main story, but that too is kinda .... Ehhhhhh~
It's just all over the place making sure that it includes references to everything in all of the spin-off games.
It legitimately took until I finished the main stories of all the Disney worlds before any real progress was made at all towards Sora's story.
Because Sora went to the Metroid School of Losing All Your Abilities, the first huge portion of the game is just spent "recover your power and then we'll do something story related".
"Until then, have a bunch of cutscenes just trying to establish all of the story you missed in the side games."
Oh! And all of the Final Fantasy characters are gone, and there's no Colosseum arena anymore either.
I'm seeing a lot of 8s and 9s from reviewers, but I wouldn't give it higher than a 6 or 7 myself honestly...
It's fucking Square Enix. How they didn't get the rights to reuse their own character is utterly beyond me!
